title: Dying
data:
- - *This article is about the player character's death. For the monster named Death, see [Riders#Death](/wiki/Riders#Death "Riders").*
  - *For "die" as in dice rolls, see [D notation](/wiki/D_notation "D notation").*

When you reach zero [hit points](/wiki/Hit_points "Hit points"), you **die**. **Death** is also possible when you have nonzero hit points, by several methods of [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath") or [delayed instadeath](/wiki/Delayed_instadeath "Delayed instadeath"). You lose all the progress you made in that game, and you may have your [possessions identified](/wiki/Do_you_want_your_possessions_identified%3F "Do you want your possessions identified?"), see your [attributes](/wiki/Enlightenment#Attributes_displayed "Enlightenment") at the time of death (as well as a single post-mortem attribute), see a list of vanquished creatures, see a list of monsters [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide"), and see which official [conducts](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") you have adhered to.

Dying may also create a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") file.

A particularly spectacular character death, especially of a character that is was well on the way to [ascension](/wiki/Ascension "Ascension"), is often called a **splat**. Watching splats (live or on Splat TV) is a part of [the fun of social *NetHack*](/wiki/Fun#The_fun_of_social_NetHack "Fun").

## Resurrection

Death in *NetHack* is permanent, unlike in many other games; you only have one life, and you cannot go to an older save file. Doing so artificially—[savescumming](/wiki/Savescumming "Savescumming")—is considered [cheating](/wiki/Cheating "Cheating"). However, there are a couple of in-game methods of cheating death. If you run out of hit points while [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") and not wearing an [amulet of unchanging](/wiki/Amulet_of_unchanging "Amulet of unchanging"), you will return to your normal form, but if you die in any other way while polymorphed, it will be permanent. An [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving") will bring you back from almost all deaths at the cost of one point of [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution"). The exceptions are brainlessness from a mind flayer's attack and self-genocide.

If playing in [explore mode](/wiki/Explore_mode "Explore mode") or [wizard mode](/wiki/Wizard_mode "Wizard mode"), you can choose whether or not to die.

## Messages

- You die...

  The usual death message, shown when you die through [hit point](/wiki/Hit_point "Hit point") loss, [choking](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"), [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") loss from the [drain strength](/wiki/Drain_strength "Drain strength") spell, and many special [monster attacks](/index.php?title=Monster_attack\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Monster attack (page does not exist)") including [passive attacks](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack").

See individual pages for more specific messages seen on player death.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.](/images/3/37/Nh364-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Dying

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
This article is about the player character's death. For the monster named Death, see Riders#Death.
For "die" as in dice rolls, see D notation.

When you reach zero hit points, you die. Death is also possible when you have nonzero hit points, by several methods of instadeath or delayed instadeath. You lose all the progress you made in that game, and you may have your possessions identified, see your attributes at the time of death (as well as a single post-mortem attribute), see a list of vanquished creatures, see a list of monsters genocided, and see which official conducts you have adhered to.

Dying may also create a bones file.

A particularly spectacular character death, especially of a character that is was well on the way to ascension, is often called a splat. Watching splats (live or on Splat TV) is a part of the fun of social NetHack.

Resurrection

Death in NetHack is permanent, unlike in many other games; you only have one life, and you cannot go to an older save file. Doing so artificially—savescumming—is considered cheating. However, there are a couple of in-game methods of cheating death. If you run out of hit points while polymorphed and not wearing an amulet of unchanging, you will return to your normal form, but if you die in any other way while polymorphed, it will be permanent. An amulet of life saving will bring you back from almost all deaths at the cost of one point of constitution. The exceptions are brainlessness from a mind flayer's attack and self-genocide.

If playing in explore mode or wizard mode, you can choose whether or not to die.

Messages

You die...
The usual death message, shown when you die through hit point loss, choking, strength loss from the drain strength spell, and many special monster attacks including passive attacks.

See individual pages for more specific messages seen on player death.

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.4. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

{{otheruses|the player character's death|the monster named Death|Riders#Death}}{{otheruses||"die" as in dice rolls|D notation}}

When you reach zero [[hit points]], you '''die'''. '''Death''' is also possible when you have nonzero hit points, by several methods of [[instadeath]] or [[delayed instadeath]]. You lose all the progress you made in that game, and you may have your [[Do you want your possessions identified?|possessions identified]], see your [[Enlightenment#Attributes displayed|attributes]] at the time of death (as well as a single post-mortem attribute), see a list of vanquished creatures, see a list of monsters [[genocide]]d, and see which official [[conduct]]s you have adhered to.

Dying may also create a [[bones]] file.

A particularly spectacular character death, especially of a character that is was well on the way to [[ascension]], is often called a '''splat'''. Watching splats (live or on Splat TV) is a part of [[Fun#The fun of social NetHack|the fun of social ''NetHack'']].

==Resurrection==
Death in ''NetHack'' is permanent, unlike in many other games; you only have one life, and you cannot go to an older save file. Doing so artificially—[[savescumming]]—is considered [[cheating]].
However, there are a couple of in-game methods of cheating death.  If you run out of hit points while [[polymorph]]ed and not wearing an [[amulet of unchanging]], you will return to your normal form, but if you die in any other way while polymorphed, it will be permanent.  An [[amulet of life saving]] will bring you back from almost all deaths at the cost of one point of [[constitution]].  The exceptions are brainlessness from a mind flayer's attack and self-genocide.

If playing in [[explore mode]] or [[wizard mode]], you can choose whether or not to die.

==Messages==
{{message|You die...|The usual death message, shown when you die through [[hit point]] loss, [[nutrition|choking]], [[strength]] loss from the [[drain strength]] spell, and many special [[monster attack]]s including [[passive attack]]s.}}

See individual pages for more specific messages seen on player death.
